conclusion: Four identical wooden blocks are on a smooth horizontal surface; blocks B and C are connected by a light spring; a horizontal force F is applied to block B; the system accelerates together with acceleration a; determine static friction on block D.
Net force on the system is consistent with total mass and acceleration: F = 4ma.
Block A accelerates with force ma provided by the spring attached to block B.
Block B experiences external force F = 4ma; some force is used for its own acceleration ma, rest is transmitted through the spring.
Block C is accelerated by the spring force from block B and provides necessary force for block D's acceleration.
Block D is accelerated by force from block C; force for its acceleration comes from static friction between block C and D.
Static friction force f_s responsible for block D's acceleration is ma.
The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D is ma.
